instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fluid contact
threads.message:
Hello,

I'm reading a 15 ohm reading on the <SIGNAL>PP1V1_S3</SIGNAL> (L8100). and the buzzer goes off. Could it be a dead CPU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fluid contact
threads.message: Just in case, compare the reading with good board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fluid contact
threads.message: I don't have another card, don't you have it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fluid contact
threads.message:
I don't have comparison board here.
On Internet, 0.163 is the normal value reported for diode mode to ground.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]
